text: In this tutorial on how to use Facebook,

we will be covering how
to add friends, posting,

liking and commenting,
Groups, Marketplace,
Pages, and the Watch tab.
Use the clickable sections below

to keep track of your
steps during this tutorial.
Once you're signed in on your homepage,

tap the search icon and type
in the name of the person
you want to add as a friend.
When you find them,
you can either tap the add friend icon

or go to their profile
and tap "Add Friend."
The process is similar on desktop,
and you can even hover over their name
and click "Add Friend" from the pop-up.

The friend you add will then
accept or deny your request.
To write a post or a status,
tap the "What's on your mind?" field
and then tap the "Write something" box.
Once you're done typing,
you can select the "Public" box
to control who sees your post.

You can also change the
background of your post,
add photos and videos,
tag specific friends, and much more.
To like and comment on a post,

scroll down on your feed until
you see a compelling post.
Hold down the like icon
and choose the emotion that best suits
how you feel about that post.

To comment on a post,
tap the comment box here.

If you want to respond to a
specific person or a comment,

tap "Reply," and the person
will be tagged in your comment.

Facebook Groups are
community spaces to network
with friends, acquaintances, or strangers

with similar interests to connect
and discuss shared topics.
To join a group, search the keyword
that describes the group you want to join.
Select the "Groups" tab on mobile
or under search results on desktop
and find the group you want to join.

Some groups are public and will
allow you to join instantly,
while others that may be public or private

will need to approve your
request before you can join.
Facebook Marketplace is a destination

for people to discover,
buy, and sell items.
Tap the hamburger menu,
then tap "Marketplace" on mobile.

You will also find it on
your desktop homepage.
Make sure to update the city you're in
to get accurate listings.
People can find what they're looking for

by filtering the results by
location, category, and price.
Tap the "Categories" tab
and select the specific category
based on your needs and wants.
You can also select "Local Listings"
if you want to see a variety
of items being sold in your area.
Once you see an item you're interested in,
you can contact the seller over Messenger

to inquire more about the
item or make an offer.
Make sure not to provide any personal
or payment information over Messenger.
To sell an item, tap the "Sell" tab
and create a new listing.

You'll be prompted to select
one of four categories
for the item or service you wish to sell.
Select the appropriate category,

then follow the prompts
to finish your listing.

Facebook Pages are public
profiles specifically created
for businesses, brands, celebrities,
causes, and other organizations.
Tap the hamburger menu,
then tap "Pages" on mobile.

You can also find it on
your desktop homepage, here.
Tap the "Discover" tab to find pages

of businesses or organizations
that you're interested in
and tap the like icon to follow them.
To create your own page for a business
or organization you're passionate about,
select the "Create" tab

and follow the prompts to
finish creating your page.
You will also be able to access
all your various pages here as well.
Facebook Watch is a section on Facebook
that allows you to view, share, react,

and comment on videos uploaded
by creators and publishers.
Tap the hamburger menu,
then tap "Watch" on mobile.

Watch can also be found here,
on your desktop homepage.
